REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

A healthcheck endpoint for the API.

This endpoint is used to check the health of the API. It returns a 200 OK response with a welcome message if the database is configured correctly. If the database is not configured, it raises a 500 Internal Server Error with a detail message.

Returns:

A dictionary with a single key “message” and a value “Welcome to FastAPI!”.

Return type:

dict

main.lifespan(app: FastAPI)[source]¶

Lifespan function that initializes FastAPILimiter with Redis connection.

Initializes FastAPILimiter with Redis connection. This function is used as a lifespan function for FastAPI application.

It yields control back to the ASGI framework after initializing FastAPILimiter and closes the Redis connection when the application is shutting down.

async main.root(requests: Request)[source]¶

The root route of the API. It returns a simple HTML page with a welcome message.

The page is rendered using a Jinja2 template and the request object is passed as a variable to the template.

The status code of this route is 200 OK.

Parameters:

requests (fastapi.Request) – The request object.

Returns:

The rendered HTML page.

Return type:

fastapi.responses.HTMLResponse

async main.user_agent_ban_middleware(request: Request, call_next: Callable)[source]¶

This middleware bans requests from user-agents that match a list of regex patterns.

The list of regex patterns is defined in the user_agent_ban_list variable. If a request’s user-agent matches any of the patterns, it is rejected with a 403 Forbidden response.

Otherwise, the request is passed on to the next middleware in the chain.

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactShema, user: User, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Create a new contact for the current user.

This function checks if a contact with the same email or phone already exists for the current user. If it does not exist, it creates a new contact and assigns it to the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactShema) – The contact details to create.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session dependency.

Returns:

The newly created contact if successful, or None if a contact with the same email or phone already exists.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Delete a contact for the current user.

This function checks if a contact with the given ID exists for the current user. If it does, it deletes the contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session dependency.

Returns:

The deleted contact if successful, or None if the contact does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, user: User, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Retrieve a contact by ID for the current user.

This function returns a contact that belongs to the current user and matches the given ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user dependency.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session dependency.

Returns:

The contact that matches the given ID, or None if not found.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, query: str | None, db: AsyncSession, user: User)[source]¶

Retrieve a list of contacts for the current user.

This function returns a list of contacts that belong to the current user.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • offset (int) – The number of contacts to skip before starting to collect the result set. Must be non-negative.

  • query (str | None) – An optional search query to filter contacts by name, email, phone, birthday, or additional data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session dependency.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user dependency.

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria.

Return type:

list[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactShema, user: User, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Update an existing contact for the current user.

This function checks if a contact with the given ID exists for the current user. If it does, it updates the contact with the provided details.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactShema) – The new contact details.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session dependency.

Returns:

The updated contact if successful, or None if the contact does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → UserShema[source]¶

Update the avatar for the user with the given email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • url (str | None) – The URL of the avatar to set. If None, the avatar will be cleared.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

The updated user.

Return type:

UserShema

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Confirm a user’s email by verifying the given token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The verification token to use.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Raises:

  • HTTPException – If the given token is invalid or has an invalid scope.

  • If the email associated with the token is not confirmed. –

  • If the token is invalid. –

Returns:

A dictionary containing a message indicating whether the email was confirmed or not.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Login a user with the given email and password.

Args: body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm): The user’s email and password. db (Session): The database session.

Raises: HTTPException: If the given email or password is invalid. If the email is not confirmed.

Returns: TokenShema: The access and refresh tokens.

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Get a new access and refresh token from a refresh token.

Args: credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials): The refresh token to use. db (Session): The database session.

Raises: HTTPException: If the given refresh token is invalid or has an invalid scope. If the email associated with the refresh token is not confirmed. If the refresh token is invalid.

Returns: TokenShema: The new access and refresh tokens.

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Request a verification email for a user.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The user’s email.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – The background tasks to add the email sending task to.

  • request (Request) – The current request.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a message indicating whether the email was sent or not.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserShema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Create a new user with the given email, username and password.

Args: body (UserShema): The user’s email, username and password. bt (BackgroundTasks): The background tasks to add the email sending task to. request (Request): The current request. db (Session): The database session.

Raises: HTTPException: If the given email already exists.

Returns: UserResponse: The created user.

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactShema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Create a new contact for the current user.

This endpoint creates a new contact and assigns it to the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactShema) – The contact to create.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session dependency.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user dependency.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If a contact with the same email or phone already exists.

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Delete a contact for the current user.

This endpoint deletes an existing contact that belongs to the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session dependency.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user dependency.

Returns:

A 204 status code with a message if the contact is found and deleted.

Return type:

HTTPException

Raises:

HTTPException – A 404 status code with a message if the contact is not found.

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), query: str | None = Query(None), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Retrieve a list of contacts for the current user.

This endpoint returns a paginated list of contacts that belong to the current user. The results can be filtered by a search query.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return. Defaults to 10.

  • offset (int) – The number of contacts to skip before starting to collect the result set. Must be non-negative. Defaults to 0.

  • query (str | None) – An optional search query to filter contacts by name, email, phone, birthday, or additional data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session dependency.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user dependency.

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria.

Return type:

list[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.get_user(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Retrieve a contact by ID for the current user.

This endpoint returns a contact that belongs to the current user and matches the given ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session dependency.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user dependency.

Returns:

The contact that matches the given ID.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found or does not belong to the current user.

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactShema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Update a contact for the current user.

This endpoint updates an existing contact that belongs to the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactShema) – The new data for the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session dependency.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user dependency.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

REST API routes Email tracker¶

async src.routes.email_tracker.email_tracker(username: str, response: Response, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Endpoint for tracking email openning.

This endpoint will be used to track whether the user has opened the email or not.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the user.

  • response (Response) – The response object.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

A FileResponse object containing the image.

Return type:

FileResponse

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Retrieve the current user.

This endpoint returns the current authenticated user.

Returns:

The current user.

Return type:

UserResponse

async src.routes.users.upload_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Uploads and updates the avatar for the current user.

This endpoint allows the current authenticated user to upload a new avatar image. The image is uploaded to Cloudinary, and the user’s avatar URL is updated in the database.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The avatar image file to be uploaded.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The updated user with the new avatar URL.

Return type:

UserResponse

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)[source]¶

Creates an access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The time delta until the token expires. Defaults to 15 minutes.

Returns:

The encoded access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)[source]¶

Creates a token for email verification.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The data to encode in the token.

Returns:

The encoded token.

Return type:

str

Notes

The token is valid for 7 days.

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)[source]¶

Creates a refresh token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The time delta until the token expires. Defaults to 7 days.

Returns:

The encoded refresh token.

Return type:

str

Decodes a refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The token to decode.

Returns:

The email associated with the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or has an invalid scope.

verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)[source]¶

Verifies a plain password against a hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain password to be verified.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password to be verified against.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False if they don’t.

Return type:

bool

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)[source]¶

Sends an email to the specified recipient with a verification link.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The recipient’s email address.

  • username (str) – The recipient’s username.

  • host (str) – The host URL used to construct the verification link.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there is an issue with sending the email.
